revised_title: Resonant Electron Scattering by Atoms: A Study of Resonant States and Scattering Matrix
tldr: This article explores the resonant electron scattering by atoms, focusing on the resonant states and scattering matrix. The authors use a variational method to calculate the energies and widths of these resonant states and discuss their threshold behavior and decay mechanisms. They also analyze the nature of the wave functions and the probability of elastic and inelastic decay.
